subject: probability
title: Expectation of Continuous Random Variables
contentHtml:
The expectation of a continuous random variable is a fundamental concept in probability theory.

Given a continuous random variable X with probability density function (PDF) f(x), the expectation E[X] can be calculated as an integral:

\(E[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x \cdot f(x) dx\)

This formula represents the mean value of the distribution, which is often referred to as the 'balance point'.

name: Continuous Expectation" },
contentHtml:
The expectation of a continuous random variable X is the balance point of its probability distribution.

  • It's calculated as the integral of the product of each possible value and its probability density function (PDF).
intuition: Think of it like finding the center of gravity for your probability mass.
